itemDescription: Brit expelled from Zimbabwe for not supporting apartheid 1912-2013

wikipedia_page.main: Frances Mary "Molly" Clutton-Brock (born Frances Mary Allen; 3 February 1912 – 27 April 2013) was a British therapist and youth worker, noted for helping physically disabled children. She and her husband developed a racially integrated farm and Molly developed centres in Rhodesia and Botswana where handicapped children could receive physical therapy. She and her husband were expelled from Rhodesia (subsequently Zimbabwe) for not supporting the white minority government.
